Engl. 24, m. statsbidr. i Finl. 33. Lär. v. Berga lantbr:sk. i Västerhaninge 23-24, v. Bjärka-Säby lant-br :sk. 24-30, jordbr.-husdjurskonsu- |lent h. Gotl. »läns hush rsällsk. sed. 30. Sekr. i Fören. f. gotl. utegångsfåret sed. 31, i Fören. t. den varmblod. häst-avelns främj. på Gotl. sed. 33, i Goil. hästavelsfören. sed. 37 samt i kristidsstyr. i Gotl. län sed. 44. Skr.: Stambok f. Skogsruss (43), art. i jordbr:-frågor i orts- o. fackpress. Hobby: jordbruk. Sv. fåravelsfören. SM, Klubbens f. ’SV. lantrasfåret SM.
translated: Ljunggren, Bengt Johan Olof, livestock consultant, Visby, born on February 27, 1900 in Tegelsmora, Uppsala County, the first child of construction engineer Gottfrid L. and Elin Sjöblom. Married on February 28, 19xx to Elisabeth Wistrand. Children: Birgitta, born in 1929, Ragnhild in 1931, Gunnar in 1934, and Bertil in 1940. Completed studies at Skövde in 1918, agricultural studies at Ultuna in 1923. Studied abroad with a scholarship in Denmark, Germany, Switzerland, Holland, Belgium, and England in 1924, and with a government grant in Finland in 1933. Worked as a teacher at Berga agricultural school in Västerhaninge from 1923 to 1924, at Bjärka-Säby agricultural school from 1924 to 1930. Has been an agricultural and livestock consultant for the Gotland County Agricultural Society since 1930. Secretary for the Gotland Association for Outdoor Sheep since 1931, for the Gotland Association for Warmblood Horse Breeding since 1933, for the Gotland Horsemanship Association since 1937, and for the wartime administration in Gotland County since 1944. Writings: Stud Book for Grey Shetland Ponies (1943), articles on agricultural matters in local and professional press. Hobby: farming. Swedish Sheep Breeding Association Swedish Championship, Swedish Native Breed Sheep Club Championship.
